intro: Echium brevirame, commonly known as the short-stemmed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers in late summer, which are arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Echium brevirame is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
